LanguageData.SexualityDisabledWarning: Psychology's sexuality system is disabled, either by you or by the presence of a conflicting mod on your mod list. Please disable any other mods that alter colonist sexuality or interaction.
LanguageData.KinseyDescription: The Kinsey scale describes a person's sexual orientation, and ranges from 0, meaning exclusively heterosexual, to a 6, meaning exclusively homosexual.\n\nKinsey recognized that the seven categories of the scale could not fully capture every individual's sexuality. He wrote that "it should be recognized that the reality includes individuals of every intermediate type, lying in a continuum between the two extremes and between each and every category on the scale."
LanguageData.SexDriveDescription: Sex drive, also known as libido, describes a person's overall desire for sexual activity.
LanguageData.AsexualDescription: This pawn has a very low sex drive. They don't experience much sexual attraction and are unlikely to engage in anything intimate, but may still engage in romance.
LanguageData.RomanticDriveDescription: Romantic drive describes a person's overall desire for romantic relationships.
LanguageData.AromanticDescription: This pawn has a very low romantic drive. They are unlikely to make romance attempts or accept marriage proposals, but may still take lovers.
LanguageData.PersonalityNodeWarning: You are editing the raw values of a pawn's personality. The actual stats will be adjusted by other factors.
LanguageData.ConversationTooltip: People will talk about {0}, and {1} to discuss this with each other.
LanguageData.BigFiveODescription: {0} is the willingness to embrace novel actions, ideas, values, feelings, fantasy, and aesthetics.
LanguageData.BigFiveCDescription: {0} is the propensity for diligence, efficiency, organization, self-discipline, and duty.
LanguageData.BigFiveEDescription: {0} is the rate that gratification is sought from outside oneself, and manifests itself in outgoing, talkative, energetic, assertive, and gregarious behavior.
LanguageData.BigFiveADescription: {0} is the capacity for kindness, sympathy, cooperation, warmth, politeness, and compassion.
LanguageData.BigFiveNDescription: {0} is the tendency towards negative emotions such as anxiety, worry, fear, anger, frustration, envy, guilt, depressed mood, and loneliness.
